body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug
/sig testing

**What happened**:

The test ``[sig-api-machinery] AdmissionWebhook Should be able to deny attaching pod`` can randomly fail because the test never waits for the pod to get into a ``Running`` state before trying to execute ``kubectl attach``. This can happen more frequently when it has to pull the necessary image. Additionally, spawning and starting pods takes a bit longer on Windows nodes.

    â¢ Failure [88.631 seconds]
    [sig-api-machinery] AdmissionWebhook
    /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/apimachinery/framework.go:22
      Should be able to deny attaching pod [It]
      /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/apimachinery/webhook.go:125

      Oct  8 16:36:05.987: unexpected 'kubectl attach' error message. expected to contain "attaching to pod 'to-be-attached-pod' is not allowed", got "error running &{/usr/local/bin/kubectl [kubectl --server=https://k8s-cbelu-6.eastus.cloudapp.azure.com --kubeconfig=/home/ubuntu/kube/config_6 attach --namespace=e2e-tests-webhook-d8clc to-be-attached-pod -i -c=container1] []  <nil>  If you don't see a command prompt, try pressing enter.\nerror: unable to upgrade connection: container container1 not found in pod to-be-attached-pod_e2e-tests-webhook-d8clc\n [] <nil> 0xc0018941b0 exit status 1 <nil> <nil> true [0xc0002d1808 0xc0002d1838 0xc0002d1860] [0xc0002d1808 0xc0002d1838 0xc0002d1860] [0xc0002d1820 0xc0002d1850] [0x92bfb0 0x92bfb0] 0xc00074dd40 <nil>}:\nCommand stdout:\n\nstderr:\nIf you don't see a command prompt, try pressing enter.\nerror: unable to upgrade connection: container container1 not found in pod to-be-attached-pod_e2e-tests-webhook-d8clc\n\nerror:\nexit status 1\n"

Additionally, the ``kubectl attach`` command could hang (if it actually managed to attach), causing the test to never end. The command should be executed with a timeout.

**What you expected to happen**:

The test should wait for the pod to enter a ``Running`` state before trying to attach to it, so it won't randomly fail.
The test should have a timeout when trying to attach to the pod.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

Run the ``[sig-api-machinery] AdmissionWebhook Should be able to deny attaching pod`` test using Windows nodes and / or delete webhook image from the Compute Node's image cache.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.12.0-rc.2
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: N/A
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Windows Server 1803 compute nodes
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): N/A
- Install tools: N/A
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: webhook test can randomly fail because it never waits for the pod to be Running
